title.narrative: Support ensuring the provision of lifesaving Sexual and Reproductive Health response services to Women, girls and young people affected by the Tropical Storm GOMBE in Nampula and Zambézia provinces, in Mozambique

description.narrative: This UNFPA project will Support the provision of lifesaving Sexual and Reproductive Health response services to Women, girls, and young people affected by the Tropical Storm GOMBE in Nampula and Zambézia provinces, in Mozambique. Reestablishment of SRH/GBV Services in the affected Districts, including for the provision of Emergency Obstetric and Neonatal Care. This UNFPA project will also Deploy mobile brigades for the provision of integrated SRH and GBV response Services, Deploys MCH nurses for the provision of SRH Services in temporary health clinics and support the mobile brigades deployed to the accommodation centers, Procures life-Saving Commodities including IARH kits and supports the PSEA Network efforts in the target provinces. The targeted beneficiaries, for this component, total 44,000 people, including 37,020 women, 8,800 girls, and 500 persons with disabilities.

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

description.narrative: Disbursement to CERF Project Support ensuring the provision of lifesaving Sexual and Reproductive Health response services to Women, girls and young people affected by the Tropical Storm GOMBE in Nampula and Zambézia provinces, in Mozambique

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.

description.narrative: Health facilities provided with inter-agency reproductive health kits (including essential medicines and supplies) to ensure availability of lifesaving SRH services for women and girls of reproductive age.
Number of cases of caesarean section managed in the referral health facilities
Number of health facilities supported with SRH kits
Number of pregnant women reached through the clean delivery kits provided by UNFPA
RH.1 Number of births attended by skilled health personnel
Humanitarian actors in Nampula and Zambézia with increased knowledge on “Do no harm” and PSEA principles.
Number of Humanitarian actors in Nampula and Zambézia briefed on PSEA Principles, Mozambique Code of Conduct, case identification and referral. 30 Humanitarian actors (5 per District)
Number of Humanitarian actors in Nampula and Zambézia briefed on protection mainstreaming related to assistance for “Do no harm”. 30 Humanitarian actors (5 per District)
Sexual and Reproductive Health (SRH) needs identified in affected areas and Maternal and neonatal mortality and morbidity prevented
AP.7 Number of community-based complaints\feedback mechanisms established
Number of health facilities with essential SRH services re-established and fully operational;

SP.2b Number of people accessing services enabled by inter-agency emergency reproductive health kits (Number of persons reached with essential SRH services (Antinatal care, birth, post-partum care, family planning and clinical management of rape) and information at the health facility and through the mobile brigades. )
